quest.name: Spirithold Broken
journal: Galfrid, chief instructor at the Bannock, would entrust you with the task of investigating Spirithold.

You learn that a party of conjurers and their Wood Wailer escort were attacked by a towering shadow while performing a sacred rite inside Spirithold. Report to Alestan, who stands guard at the dungeon's entrance, and request further orders.
While the majority of those who entered Spirithold have been evacuated, two conjurers, three Wood Wailers, and the Hearer remain unaccounted for. Locate the missing, and rescue any survivors.
Only the Hearer remains, somewhere in the dungeon's depths. Find him and ensure that he leaves Spirithold alive.
You encounter a mysterious masked mage who unleashes a clay golem upon you. After a desperate struggle, you manage to dispatch the automaton just as Yda and Papalymo arrive.

The presence of the two scholars triggers yet another inexplicable vision inside your mind. Though your soul cries out for answers, this is neither the time nor place to ask questions. Report to Alestan outside Spirithold.

Alestan listens intently as you recount all that unfolded within Spirithold. Understandably concerned, the Wood Wailer promises to investigate the masked mage, and bids you return to Gridania and speak with Miounne.

Safely back in Gridania, you relate your tale to Miounne, only for her to forbid you from repeating the story to others. What strange forces could be at work in the Twelveswood? Such matters are best left to the Hearers, it would seem. For now, take advantage of Miounne's introduction to guildleves, as well as her offer of guild accommodations, and prepare yourself for future adventures.
objectives: Rescue the missing conjurers and Wood Wailers.
Return to Gridania and speak with Miounne.

dialogue.name: GALFRID
dialogue.text: Forename! Thank the gods you've come!

dialogue.name: GALFRID
dialogue.text: We have a potential crisis on our hands, and I would appreciate your assistance. Will you hear me out?

dialogue.name: GALFRID
dialogue.text: Listen well, for we haven't much time.

dialogue.name: GALFRID
dialogue.text: To the southeast of here lies a dungeon known as Spirithold. It was all but destroyed during the Calamity.

dialogue.name: GALFRID
dialogue.text: Desiring to offer the ruins back to the forest, a Hearer ventured inside to carry out the Rite of Returning.

dialogue.name: GALFRID
dialogue.text: Alas, it would seem something has gone awry. Word arrived just moments ago that the Hearer and his guards have been attacked by a towering shadow. Aye, you heard me true─a shadow.

dialogue.name: GALFRID
dialogue.text: On any other day, I would dispatch my best Quivermen to provide support, but I sent them to repel an Ixali incursion in the West Shroud nary a bell ago.

dialogue.name: GALFRID
dialogue.text: The timing of these events cannot be mere coincidence. I fear the Ixal somehow caught wind of our plans, and are attempting to disrupt the rite in an effort to weaken the bond between man and elemental.

dialogue.name: GALFRID
dialogue.text: They must not be allowed to succeed. And so I bid you go to Spirithold and do whatever is necessary to resolve the situation. Please, say you will help us.

dialogue.name: GALFRID
dialogue.text: I knew you would not let me down. You will have all the support I can muster.

dialogue.name: GALFRID
dialogue.text: Now, we are racing against time, so you had best make haste.

dialogue.name: ALESTAN
dialogue.text: Who goes there? An adventurer, is it?

dialogue.name: ALESTAN
dialogue.text: Here at Instructor Galfrid's request, you say? Thank the Matron!

dialogue.name: ALESTAN
dialogue.text: Doubtless you already know this, but a towering shadow manifested without warning and attacked the Hearer in the midst of the rite.

dialogue.name: ALESTAN
dialogue.text: Most of his party has been successfully evacuated, but five remain unaccounted for.

dialogue.name: ALESTAN
dialogue.text: Please find them, and see them out of harm's way.

dialogue.name: KIKOKUA
dialogue.text: <groan> A great shadow...towering over me... What in the Twelve's good grace?

dialogue.name: KIKOKUA
dialogue.text: A-An adventurer!? Please, you must save the Hearer!

dialogue.name: KIKOKUB
dialogue.text: Galfrid...sent you?

dialogue.name: KIKOKUB
dialogue.text: I am no longer...of use here. Pray help the Hearer...in my stead.

dialogue.name: KIKOKUC
dialogue.text:
Away, vile fiend! Away, I say! I defy you! I defy yooouuu!!!
...Uh? ...Oh! An adventurer!

dialogue.name: KIKOKUC
dialogue.text: W-We were ambushed─ambushed in the midst of the ritual! And then... And then...I'm not sure what happened.

dialogue.name: CONJURERA
dialogue.text: ...You were sent to help? I fear you are too late─the ritual has failed.

dialogue.name: CONJURERA
dialogue.text: I must needs return to Gridania. The Seedseers must know of this.

dialogue.name: CONJURERB
dialogue.text: That thing was no elemental, but a being born of darkness.

dialogue.name: CONJURERB
dialogue.text: The Hearer languishes alone in the depths. You must help him!

dialogue.name: CONJURERC
dialogue.text: Do not mind me... Save the others...

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: O mournful voice of creation! Grant ye this humble stone a soul, that it may wake to life!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Defeat the clay golem!

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: That the golem could be vanquished...

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: That womanman is no ordinary adventurer.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Damnation! He has eluded us yet again!

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Oh, fancy meeting you here! How are things?

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Hm? Whatever are you─

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Shhh! More birds! This makes it how many times today? Seven?

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Their movements are beyond our fathoming.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: They are up to something, that much is plain─the question is, what?

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Hmmm. Do you think maybe...they're trying to summon their primal?

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: I hope not, for all our sakes. Yet we must be prepared for the worst.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Withered. The same fate has befallen Emerald Moss.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: It is as we feared: Dalamud's anomaly is affecting life in the Twelveswood.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: You mean the disturbance in the aetheric flow?

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: The very same. The Garleans have a lot to answer for.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: The imbalance they have created is plunging the land into chaos, just as Louisoix forewarned.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: It's no wonder the primals have started appearing...

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Time is against us, but there is still hope for the land.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: We must hold fast to that hope and fight to the very last.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Agreed!

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Waaah!

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Ack! Stupid things...

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: These stupid things happen to be the very latest in Sharlayan innovation! Show some respect!

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: But they're so uncomfortable and...and...ugly!

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: If you ask me, they're an improvement over that mask of yours.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: <sigh> Hard to believe it's already been five whole years, isn't it?

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Already? Five years is but a heartbeat in the life of the planet!

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: I suppose you're right... Now that I think about it, the Twelveswood's barely recovered at all, and the Gridanians still have the same old problems.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Aye, along with some new ones. Just in case the Ixal and Garuda weren't troublesome enough, the sylphs had to go and invite Ramuh, didn't they?

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: ...Do you ever think about those adventurers who fought alongside us? I do. And then five years seems like ages... I wonder what became of them.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Ah...

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Yda, look.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Hm?

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text:
Golly!
...And this is what, exactly?

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Yet another disturbance in the aether, and freshly manifested at that.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: It seems to be emanating from Lifemend Stump. We must hurry!

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Are you all right? Your eyes glazed over for a while there.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: The good news is that the Hearer is unharmed. Somewhat dazed, yes, but whole of mind and body. The bad news...concerns everything else.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Lest you forget, the Twelveswood is the domain of the elementals; it is by their leave that man abides in the forest and avails himself of its bounty. The ground which the dungeon occupies is no different.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Having no more use for the dungeon, the Gridanians sent a Hearer to offer the place back to the elementals by way of the Rite of Returning, which is essentially an expression of gratitude.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Alas, he failed to complete the ritual for obvious reasons.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: While the poor soul cannot be blamed for this, the fact remains that unless the elementals are given their due, they may well consider it a slight. And the very last thing the Gridanians can afford to do in these uncertain times is risk alienating the Twelveswood's eternal guardians.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: But you have more than done your part. We shall see the Hearer to safety, and send for his peers to finish the rite.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: In the meantime, please make your way outside and report to Alestan.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Ah, but where are my manners?

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: I am Papalymo, and the tactless woman beside me here is─

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Yda!

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Papalymo and I are surveying the Twelveswood together!

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Pleased to meet you!

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Yda, give me a hand, would you?

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Wait. There is something...familiar about you. Could it be that you are...?

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: N-Never mind. Doubtless my eyes are playing tricks. Till we meet again!

dialogue.name: ALESTAN
dialogue.text: All this happened inside Spirithold? Twelve preserve us...

dialogue.name: ALESTAN
dialogue.text: Who was that masked mage, and by what dark ambition is he driven? So many things shrouded in mystery...

dialogue.name: ALESTAN
dialogue.text: Well, I shan't find any answers on my own. I must needs discuss this with Galfrid. The matter warrants a full investigation, if I am any judge, and that shall certainly be my recommendation.

dialogue.name: ALESTAN
dialogue.text: Your courage has saved many lives this day, adventurer. For this you have my deepest gratitude.

dialogue.name: ALESTAN
dialogue.text: Pray return to Gridania and seek out Miounne.

dialogue.name: ALESTAN
dialogue.text: I understand she wishes to thank you for your efforts on our behalf.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. A little bird tells me that the Hearer and his party owe you their lives.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text:
A tale for the tavern if ever there were one!
...It is only a shame that I must ask you not to tell it─for the time being, at least. Do I make myself clear?

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Until the Hearers have made their will on the matter known, it would be best to avoid unsettling people with stories of walking statues.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Now then, you must have suitable recompense for your valiant service.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: For the first half of your reward, I give you leave to make use of the accommodations here at the guild.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Arrangements have been made, so all you need do is speak with Antoinaut whenever you crave the comfort of a firm bed and a soft pillow.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: For the second half of your reward, I offer you another path to fame and fortune: guildleves.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Guildleves are records of the various requests we receive from the citizenry. They outline all manner of tasks which ambitious young adventurers like you can elect to undertake.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Gontrant is our guildleve official, or “levemete,” here at the Carline Canopy. I have spoken with him regarding your knack for solving challenging problems, and he is eager to make your acquaintance.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: By the way, have you perchance heard about the coming festival? It is truly a splendid occasion, looked forward to by young and old alike, and one I heartily recommend that you take the time to enjoy.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Don't be too disappointed if the recent troubles cast a shadow over proceedings, however. I fear nothing short of the mysterious interloper's apprehension can prevent that...

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: But we were talking about you, Forename. You have made Mother proud. I expect great things of you, young ladyman!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In recognition of your achievements, you are now granted access to guildleves and inn rooms.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: As you complete quests and embark on new adventures, the world will draw you ever deeper into its mysteries.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The great realm of Eorzea yet holds myriad roads untraveled and sights unseen. Continue along the path of the adventurer and discover what wonders await you!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“Spirithold Broken”?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: You are strong. But are you strong enough to withstand this?

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: Yesss...writhe! Writhe in eternal darkness!

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: Impossible! Never has the golem been so sorely tested!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You now have access to Recommendations. This feature displays a list of quests or duties currently available in your area.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Recommendations list can be opened from under Duty in the main menu, and will also be displayed automatically when you log in. If you find yourself unsure of what to do next, this tool makes it simple to locate activities suitable for your present class and level.

obj.n: He's Got a Ticket to Ride
